RESOURCE.STRING: EGR Valve Test
This test can be used to open and close the EGR valve.
Opening EGR valve, Please wait.
Closing EGR valve, Please wait.
Opening EGR valve in %1!d! seconds
Closing EGR valve in %1!d! seconds
The EGR valve is not fully open
EGR Valve is not Closed.
Select Start to start the test.
To operate the EGR valve specify a delay time, then select the desired command to Open or Close the valve. To stop the test select Stop.
Select the Desired Position.
Select the Desired Position.
Select the Desired Position.
Select the Desired Position.
To operate the EGR valve specify a delay time, then select the desired command to Open or Close the valve. To stop the test select Stop.
To operate the EGR valve specify a delay time, then select the desired command to Open or Close the valve. To stop the test select Stop.
EGR Valve is Closed.
EGR Valve is Open.
Initializing test, please wait
EGR Valve is not Closed.
EGR Valve is not Open.
EGR valve position sensor circuit fault detected. Troubleshoot the EGR valve position sensor circuit fault code before proceeding with this test.
The EGR valve test could not be started. Please correct the error stated in the Status message and press Start to retry the test.
EGR valve position sensor circuit fault detected. Troubleshoot the EGR valve position sensor circuit fault code before proceeding with this test.
Test stopped, vehicle speed detected. Stop vehicle and restart test.
Instructions:

second(s) before actuation.
Valve Position

Status
Test stopped, vehicle speed detected. Stop vehicle and restart test.
Test stopped, EGR valve position sensor circuit fault detected.
Test stopped, EGR valve position sensor circuit fault detected.
EGR Valve is not Closed. Open position will not be accurate.
Test stopped.
Please correct the error stated in the Status message and press Start to retry the test.
EGR valve position failed automatic calibration procedure. Troubleshoot the EGR Valve fault code before proceeding with this test.

The EGR Valve Test allows the operator to move the EGR Valve when the engine is not running and the vehicle is not moving. The actuator contains a lightweight return spring. This may or may not cause the EGR valve to return to the open position when the EGR motor is turned off. A high pitched frequency noise can normally be heard when the EGR Valve motor is on.
